Amongt the ret, I hall preume to preent this as a publick Remark of that days Healing; which was in a Child about ix or even years old, being one of His Majeties Carriers at Windor, who having a very large Swelling of his Neck, which was but little before brought to Mr. James Molins, His Majeties Chirurgeon, and me to behold; we both advied a Cautick to be applyed thereto, the Matter which being therein contained being deeply lodged: But without following our advice, this healing hapning a few days after, I gave him a Ticket in order to his Childs being Touch'd; the which the Child having received, the Swelling the very next day did break, and Matter daily iued thence which leened its bulk, and in a hort time I aw the Child perfectly whole, and dicharged from the Swelling.

A young Child of Mr. Bradlyes, near Charing-Cros, being by me brought to the King to be healed at a private Healing at White-Hall, amongt ome others, where I only waited; being troubled with the Evil in her Eyes, which proved very troubleom and
irkome to her, very near poiling her ight, and who could carce get any Nutriment into her Mouth, which very oft threatned her uffocation: This Child within ix days after her being touched by the King, her ight amended, the hot Rheum in her Eyes abated, and her Mouth, which was o troubleome to her, became well, and he in a very hort pace perfectly cured.

Mr. James Hollyer, the Son of the famous Mr. Tho. Hollyer Chirurgeon, and my Mater, who being troubled with the Evil, and having everal running Ulcers which could not be cured by his Fathers bet Art, all imaginable means proving ineffectual, he being at length touched by our Sacred King, his Sores uddainly dryed up, and never any appearance of relape have ince hapned to him.

Elizabeth Williams having the Evil in her Eyes for many years, which made them ore by their continual gleet, for which he had ued many Medicines to little purpoe, he being Toucht by the King for the ame, did preently find eae, peedily recovered, and continues now in health.

Benjamin Fuller having a cold Tumour which eized his Elbow, in o much that he could not lift his Hand to his Mouth, nor remove it from any place without the aitance of his other, he having received His Majeties gracious Touch, did peedily amend, and became very well oon after he had received the ame.

Henry Only in St. Thomas Hopital had very large Ulcers about him like Honey-Combs, which gave him that pain that he took no ret for many days and nights; that very day he was Toucht by the King for his Ditemper, he found eae, lept well that night, his Sores oon healed up, and he to admiration hath ever ince continued well and ound.

Carington Branell, a poor Seaman, who having a cold Swelling in his Hands, that all the Tendons and Ligaments thereof were uppoed thereby to be foul, he upon receiving His Majeties gracious Touch, recovered from his Swellings by its abating and leening it elf every day, and in a hort time after ued his Hand, and grew perfectly well. Thee five lat I had from the aboveaid Mr. Molins's
Kinman, left me under his Hand, and ent me from his Mater.

Dr. Eaton tells me of two Women walking together near Oxford, which had lately come from London, with the Daughter of one of them, who had for ome time been perfectly blind with the Evil, That day he received His Majeties Touch, he at Dinner o well recovered her ight, that he having a Handkerchief hewn her, he could tell what it was: Thee two Women told the Doctor with abundance of Joy this Hitory, with thanks for the great bleing the Daughter lately received by His Majeties Sacred Hand.

There's alo another remarkable Obervation brought to me of our Soveraign's late Touch here at Whitehal, jut before he went to Newmarket this lat Meeting, where amongt the ret, a Child of an Innkeepers in Holborn, having for ome coniderable time been perfectly blind, o that he could neither ee Sun or Moon, or the Light, who upon His Majeties gracious Touch, the ame Child recovered her ight, the which he keeps, and is very well at the writing hereof.

One Thomas Cotland, (as another remark of His Majeties favour) living near Oxford, and having many Strumous Swellings about his Neck, for which he had been touched and cured; but upon leaving off his Gold, his Swellings eized him afreh: the Gold being new trung, and put again about his Neck, his Swellings uddainly abated, and he to his dying day continued ever after in health, without any appearance of relape. This alo I received from the aforeaid Doctor Eaton.

From Dr. White I had this following of a Woman in La ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ born in Berkhire, who being o grievouly troubled with the Evil, that it made her o blind, that he could not ee cros the Table; he having been toucht for the ame by the King, within les than fourteen days he recovered her ight, o that he could ditinguih between every one at the Table; and he every day o mightily amended, that in a hort pace of time he perfectly regained her ight to admiration.

From Madam Waterman, His Majeties late Phyicians Lady, I had this following Obervation of a Peron of Quality, who was much troubled with the Evil in her Eyes, as alo many running Soars behind her Ears; for the curing both of which, all imaginable means were ued before (His Majeties happy Retauration) by the mot eminent Phyicians and Chyrurgeons in London: She by all their skill and advice no whit growing better, but having ome appearance of help by longer ue of their Medicines, and did purchae greater hopes than he expected, at length advanced to a very great meaure of Cure; but this continued no long time: Some Years after His Majeties happy return into England, her Ditemper eized afreh in her Eyes, and by my Lady Ivyes advice ued everal Remedies (who for ome miles was ent for to advie about the ame) but he uing everal means to as little effect as the former, he being evermore compell'd to keep in the dark, or cloe place, where he could not endure the ight of the light, not being able to walk in or out of the Houe without leading, no
ways capable of enduring the light of the Sun or Fire, or the very appearance of Day. This Lady being touched by our Sacred King, within two days after could endure the light without trouble; and in a Weeks time he received that miraculous Change (that he without any further help) could walk abroad by her elf without any help or aitance, and hath ever ince continued free from any further Ditemper, although it hath been above fifteen or ixteen Years ince he received his Majeties gracious Touch.

The aforeaid Lady tells us likewie of Sir Nicholas Tucks two Children, who both were alo much troubled with the Evil; the one with running Soars behind her Ears, which were not to be cured by the utmot of Art; the other with oar Eyes, and an extraordinary Rhume: Both thee being touch'd by His Sacred Majety the lat Summer at Windor, received immediate Cure; as I had from the above-mention'd Ladies own Lips.

The Daughter alo of the Honored Dr. Waterman, being much troubled with the Evil in her Throat, and Swelling, which proved very troubleom to her, o that for ome time he was not able to hold up her Head, or move the ame without pain; he likewie being touch'd for the ame by His Sacred Majety, within a few days after it, he much amended, and hath ever ince continued well: But he, upon leaving off her Gold for ome time, he felt new Pains and Swellings, but no ooner had he put the ame Gold on again, but her Pain and Swelling abated, and found as peedy a Recovery, as the want of the ame gave her freh fears of its return.

This following I received alo from the aforeaid Mitres Elizabeth Bookey, which was of a near Relation of her own, of a Child of about two years old, who having very many troubles upon her, as Fevers, Agues, Vomitings, and other Illnes about that time of her Age; for which advice being askt from the mot eminent Phyicians, one amongt the ret judged it to
be an Evil humor cruiing about her Body; others were of another Opinion, he being for ome time kept under the Phyicians hands for ome years; about the eventh Year of her age, the Humor gathered afreh upon or very near her left Breat, which was o violent that it drew the child crooked, and made her to bend like a Bow: this ore was opened and dret by an eminent Chirurgeon of our City of London; it being for ome time kept open, at length healed up of a uddain, but it very quickly gathered again inwardly: The Relations then remembring the opinion of one of the mot eminent Phyicians who had formerly been conulted, & that he uppoed it to be an Evil humor, or the ame Humor that begets the ame Dieae, ued all imaginable means of having her Touch'd by the King: But he that had the mot immediate care of her, aid it was the Evil, and if it were, it was not Touching that could help her, but it mut be other means that mut effect her Cure. The Relations not being herewith atisfied, they carried the Child to Mr. Serjeant Knight, Serjeant Chirurgion to His Majety,
who was of opinion that it was not the Evil: A year or two after, this Ditemper eized her Eyes, where he met with uch a violent Rhume, that it not only blitered her Eyes, but made Scars alo in her Face: They made their econd Addres then to His Majeties Chirurgeon, who eeing the Dieae o apparently dicovered its elf, that he had a Ticket, and was touch'd by His Sacred Majety; the which he no ooner had received, but he immediatly found eae in her Eyes, and hath continued very well for thee lat ten years together, except upon leaving off her Gold, whereupon he aith he hath met with ome mall ilnes in her Eyes, which upon putting her Gold on again, hath as uddenly vanihed.

The Healing before the Kings lat meeting at New-market, which was in March, before he left the City there was a very poor Country Woman brought in a Chair to be healed, which could neither go nor tand: His Majety affording her His Royal Touch, he uddenly thereupon amended; the day following he was
able to walk about the Room; and in two days after he was o perfectly recovered, that he went into the Country freed from her former Sicknes, and dicharged from her Scrophulated Swellings.

At the ame Healing another young Woman which was very near blind, and very much diturbed with Strumous Swellings, and had alo everal running Soars about her, he being touch'd then alo by the King, received perfect Remedy by the Royal Favor of his Sacred Hand. Both thee, I my elf was Eye-witnes of, and therefore do confidently aert the truth thereof.

Being in the Society of many Perons of Quality, I had this remarkahle following Obervation from an eminent Peron of this trange Cure. A Nonconformits Child in Norfolk, being troubled with Scrophulous Swellings, the late deceaed Sir Thomas Brown of Norwich being conulted about the ame, His Majety being then at Breda or Bruges, he advied the Parents of the Child to have it carryed
over to the King (his own Method being ued ineffectually:) the Father eemed very trange at his advice, and utterly denyed it, aying, The Touch of the King was of no greater efficacy than any other Mans. The Mother of the Child adhering to the Doctors advice, tudied all imaginable means to have it over, and at lat prevailed with her Husband to let it change the Air for three Weeks or a Month; this being granted, the Friends of the Child that went with it, unknown to the Father, carried it to Breda, where the King touch'd it, and he returned home perfectly healed. The Child being come to its Fathers Houe, and he finding o great an alteration, enquires how his Daughter arrived at this Health, the Friends thereof aured him, that if he would not be angry with them, they would relate the whole Truth; they having his promie for the ame, aured him they had the Child to the King to be touch'd at Breda, whereby they apparently let him ee the great benefit his Child receiv'd thereby. Hereupon the Father became o amazed, that he threw off his Nonconformity, and expret
his thanks in this method; Farewel to all Dienters, and to all Nonconformits: If God can put o much Virtue into the King's Hand as to Heal my Child, I'll erve that God and that King o long as I live with all Thankfulnes.
The following Letter came very lately to my Hands, which I hall here inert verbatim.

body.p:
I Am informed that you are Publihing a Treatie of The Royal Gift of Healing; and knowing that many are of the Opinion that there can be no benefit received without a trong belief, &c. Therefore pray to your many Obligations, add one more, by inerting this in your Book, viz. I was very much afflicted with the Ditemper vulgarly known by the Name of the Kings-Evil, from even years of age, until the time that I received His Majeties mot gracious Touch: I was o much afflicted with it, that at ome times my Face would be o Tumefied, that I could hardly ee out,
or peak plain: my Cheeks and Neck were full of Glandules, and I had uch a running Ulcer in my upper Lip, that at ome times it appear'd like a Hare-Lip, and in a very bad condition I continued from the year 1648, until the year 1662, at which time all my Friends advied me to get the Favour of being Toucht: but I believing no further than I could ee demontrated, though none could exceed me in Loyalty, I refued to go: but in a hort time after I had ome Buines of another Nature to go to London, which having oon after I came perfected, I did not dare go home again without being Toucht, becaue I made that the pretence of my Journey. So then I went to ome Friends in London, who gave me Recommendations to Mr. Serjeant Knight, who gave me a Ticket, and I waited upon His Majety as I was directed, and received His Divine Touch; which had o good effect upon me, that in two or three days I was very much at eae; and by that time I got home, which was within a fortnight, I was perfectly well, to the great Glory of God, the Eternal Honour of His Sacred Majety, and the
Lawful Heirs of the Crown, whom God preerve. Amen. Sir, When I have the Happines to Kis your Hand, you hall have a more particular account from

closer.dateline:
From my Houe at the Globe in Whites-Alley in Chancery-Lane London,
Dec. 10. 1683.

div.p:
A poor Country-woman came with her three Siters from Oxford, to be healed by His Majety in the Week before lat Eater: this Object of Charity came to my Houe in a very mierable condition, and was as well by Serjeant Pyle, His Majeties Serjeant Chirurgeon, as my elf, viewed, and
her Ditemper was concluded by both not to be the Evil; her Legs were both extraordinarily blitered; her Stomach was o weak, that he for ome days could not eat any Dyet. I being upon pure Charity perwaded by her earnet Intreaties and Requets to have her Toucht, the which on her bended Knees he humbly requeted, with that perfect aurance, that could he attain it, he hould certainly gain her Cure; he at the publick Healing at Whitehal was Toucht by His Majety: that very night he eat two Eggs, that for above ten days before naueated any Dyet. The day following he was Toucht again, and with it he received His Majeties Gold: upon which her Sores and Bliters in her Legs dryed up, he peedily thereupon amended, and within a very few days to admiration was perfectly retrieved from her Dieae, and to this day is a viible Object of His Majeties great Cure, (the beginning and ending of which I aw) to His Sacred Thanks and Glory.

From Mr. Whitacre of Wincheter I had this following, of a Child of one Mr. Harbins of the ame place, who
being perfectly blind with the Evil, and he being Toucht by His Sacred Majety for the ame at Whitehal, he immediately received great benefit thereby, and recovered her ight to that great degree, that walking the ame day along with her Mother by the Maypole in the Strand, he askt her Mother what that long Pole was for? which he thankt God he then perfectly aw, and hath continued very well ever ince.

Elizabeth Dewolders of Fluhing in Zealand, was touched by the King for the Evil about thirteen years ince, who having many running Sores about her Neck, oon after her touching he immediately received benefit, and within a little while after her Sores perfectly dryed up. I aw this Woman my elf, who came with her Siter who was troubled with the Evil to be Toucht this intant October at Whitehal, and he is perfectly healed, and hath continued o ever ince.

William Luke of Eat-Packham in Kent, a Blackmith, who having the Evil very much in his Eyes, was toucht by the King for the ame, and received immediate benefit thereby: he
was toucht about Eater, and every year about the ame time he meets with a freh return hereof: he comes about forty miles, and every year he gains the Kings Touch, he receives Cure therewith, and goes home very well, and follows his Calling. This I had from Mr. Doublebrook, who is one of His Majeties Yeoman-Uhers, and who always brings him to the King to be Toucht.

From Mr. Millart, one of the Yeoman-Uhers to the Yeomen of the Guard, I had this, of a poor Woman who was his next Neighbour, who being o grievouly troubled with running Sores about her Neck, that he was near wated and conumed to nothing, he was brought in a Chair to the King to be Toucht, and immediately found benefit thereby, and within a hort time after he returned home to Breda in Brabant perfectly recovered, and ince that ent him a Letter, with thanks, of her continuing well to this hour.

From Mr. Doublebrook I had this following alo, of a Woman who came from Virginia, whoe Noe was almot eaten away with the Evil, and her
Eyes conumed with that Humour, he being brought by him to the King to be Toucht, immediately received benefit thereby, and returned to Virginia ince, and as a token of Thanks to him, he ent him a Pair of Gloves, with a Letter, wherein he certified him that he was recovered from her Dieae, and was perfectly healed. This he received from her within a year and a half after, from Virginia.
I might have introduced many more Examples of the great Cures which have been performed by the Sacred Hands of our Kings and Queens: but I hope thee may be ufficient to atisfie the reaonable Man.

May our Bleed SAVIOUR therefore, the great Phyician of the Soul and Body, evermore add many years to our Sacred Majeties Age, that he may always appear more glorious, as the Riing Sun over his People, diffuing of his Healing Rays: May Fortune and Glory be ever the Fruit and Pleaure of his Sacred Peron: And may he ever be himelf free from all uch Sicknes and Dieaes as he cures in others; whoe Health is the Health of his Nations, and whoe Life is the
Life of his Kingdoms: And as the great KING of Kings hath hitherto miraculouly preerved his Defender of the Faith, o may He evermore keep Him from the Malice of his evil Subjects Tongues, and from the ickly Contagion of their ill Manners. May the Preerver of Mankind furnih his Royal Peron continually with a trong Army, a faithful People, a flourihing Nation, a peaceful Church, a erene Sea, an invincible Throne, and happy Ilands; that as all the World doth pay Tribute to our Soveraign's great Name, o they may alo reverence his Divine Healing Nature.
